alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 25 at 9:23PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Norfolk, City of Portsmouth and City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 922 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Kempsville, Regent University, Virginia Wesleyan University, Norfolk State University, Downtown Norfolk, Great Bridge, Downtown Portsmouth, Old Dominion University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Norfolk International, Norview, Ghent, Princess Anne, Cradock, Norfolk NAS, Gallups Corner and Greenbrier. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach
